entry.title: Vite report on Tue, 26 Sep 2023 08:04:07
entry.summary:
Online Educational Publishing Market 2024 Analysis, Trends, Size, Share | Industry Forecast Report 2031 - Benzinga (Tech)
- The report provides an analysis of the online educational publishing market, including trends, size, and share.
- It forecasts the industry's growth and provides insights into the future of the market.

The US Air Force is using satellites and dirt runways to prepare its drones for a different kind of war (Tech)
- The US Air Force is utilizing satellites and dirt runways to train its drones for unconventional warfare.
- This approach allows the Air Force to simulate real-world scenarios and improve the capabilities of its drones.

The US is planning its first fusion plant, and it could generate pollution-free power by 2035 (Tech)
- The US is developing plans for its first fusion plant, which has the potential to produce clean and sustainable energy by 2035.
- Fusion power has the advantage of being pollution-free and could revolutionize the energy industry.

Intertwingled: Collection of videos to showcase the magic alchemy of computation (Tech)
- Intertwingled is a collection of videos that demonstrate the fascinating combination of computation and creativity.
- The videos showcase the diverse applications of computation in various fields, highlighting its transformative power.

The DJI Mini 4 Pro is the first mini with binocular vision in every direction (Tech)
- The DJI Mini 4 Pro is a groundbreaking mini drone that features binocular vision in all directions.
- This advanced technology enhances the drone's navigation and obstacle avoidance capabilities, making it safer and more efficient.

Former Amazon hardware boss Dave Limp will take over as CEO of Blue Origin (Business)
- Dave Limp, the former hardware boss at Amazon, has been appointed as the CEO of Blue Origin.
- This leadership change is expected to bring new strategies and innovations to the space exploration company.

Ford halts work on $3.5B EV battery factory with China’s CATL (Business)
- Ford has temporarily suspended the construction of a $3.5 billion electric vehicle (EV) battery factory in partnership with China's CATL.
- The decision was made due to the global semiconductor shortage, which has impacted the automotive industry.

New SEC cybersecurity disclosure rules: What you need to know to stay in compliance (Business)
- The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has introduced new cybersecurity disclosure rules.
- This report provides essential information on these rules and offers guidance on how businesses can ensure compliance.

Understanding Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in TypeScript: Key Concepts and Practical Example (AI)
- This article explains the key concepts of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in TypeScript.
- It provides a practical example to demonstrate how OOP principles can be applied in TypeScript programming.

How to Be a Good Open Source Contributor During Hacktoberfest and Beyond (AI)
- This guide offers tips on how to become a valuable open-source contributor during Hacktoberfest and beyond.
- It provides insights into the best practices and etiquette for contributing to open-source projects.

Losing Human Users, Facebook Releasing Chatbots for Lonely to Talk To (AI)
- Facebook is developing chatbots to provide companionship for lonely users.
- This move comes as the social media platform experiences a decline in human users and aims to enhance user engagement.

Intel Closes the Gap & Looks to the Future at Intel Innovation (Tech)
- Intel has made significant progress in closing the technology gap and is focusing on future innovations.
- This report highlights Intel's achievements and provides insights into its future plans and strategies.

The Ethics Expert: Episode 159 – Mita Mallick | Thomas Fox ... - JD Supra (Business)
- This episode of The Ethics Expert podcast features Mita Mallick, discussing ethical considerations in business.
- The conversation explores various topics related to ethics and provides valuable insights for business professionals.

Trends in separation science - 2023 - Journal of Separation Science - John Wiley (Tech)
- The Journal of Separation Science presents the latest trends in separation science for the year 2023.
- This article provides an overview of the advancements and innovations in the field of separation science.

As Twitter Kills Circles, Instagram Continues Work on Similar Crew Private Sharing Feature (Tech)
- Twitter has discontinued its "Circles" feature, while Instagram is developing a similar private sharing feature called "Crew."
- This report highlights the evolving landscape of social media platforms and their efforts to enhance user experiences.

Hollywood's writers strike is on the verge of ending. What happens next? (Business)
- The writers strike in Hollywood is nearing its end, raising questions about the future of the entertainment industry.
- This article explores the potential consequences and implications of the strike's resolution.

3 ChatGPT tips that have helped small-business owners nail their marketing copy — and still keep the 'human touch' (AI)
- This article provides three tips for small-business owners to effectively use ChatGPT for their marketing copy.
- The tips focus on maintaining a human touch while leveraging AI technology.

Here's what needs to happen for Ukraine to make a breakthrough against Russia's defensive lines, according to war analysts (Business)
- War analysts provide insights into the necessary steps for Ukraine to achieve a breakthrough against Russia's defensive lines.
- The analysis considers various factors and strategies that could lead to a successful outcome.

Gold bars, cash found in home of senator charged with bribery (Business)
- A senator charged with bribery had gold bars and cash discovered in their residence.
- This report highlights the legal case and the evidence found during the investigation.

Trump's 'gobbledygook' math has lowballed, for a decade, how many fish he kills to cool his Chicago tower: AG (Business)
- Former President Trump's calculations regarding the number of fish killed to cool his Chicago tower have been criticized as inaccurate.
- This article discusses the controversy surrounding the environmental impact of the tower's cooling system.

How Much Does It Take to Be the Top% in Each U.S. State? (Business)
- This report examines the income thresholds required to be in the top percentage of earners in each U.S. state.
- It provides insights into the income disparities across states and the varying levels of wealth.

Study links blue light from smartphones or tablets to early puberty (AI)
- A study has found a correlation between exposure to blue light from smartphones or tablets and early puberty.
- This research highlights the potential health effects of excessive screen time, particularly in younger individuals.

John Romero on his book “Doom Guy” and developing games at a small scale (Tech)
- John Romero discusses his book "Doom Guy" and shares insights into game development at a small scale.
- The interview provides valuable perspectives on the gaming industry and the creative process.

The Two Thangs Book: The whys of some weird paintings by Matthew Brennan aka Two Thangs (Tech)
- "The Two Thangs Book" explores the motivations and inspirations behind the unique paintings of Matthew Brennan, also known as Two Thangs.
- The book offers an in-depth look into the artist's creative process and the stories behind his artwork.

Juxtaposition: The Art of Karen Y. Buster by Karen Y. Buster (Tech)
- "Juxtaposition" showcases the art of Karen Y. Buster, highlighting her unique style and artistic vision.
- The book provides a collection of her artwork and offers insights into her creative journey.

BOYS LOVE 2 + Yaoi Coloring Book + Art of Mizuyukiiro by The Yaoi Army (Tech)
- "BOYS LOVE 2" is a compilation of artwork and stories from The Yaoi Army, featuring a yaoi coloring book and the art of Mizuyukiiro.
- The book celebrates the yaoi genre and offers a visual feast for fans.

Deluxe Collector's Hardbacks of Night of Death and Flowers by Rebecca L. Garcia (Tech)
- "Night of Death and Flowers" by Rebecca L. Garcia is a deluxe collector's hardback edition featuring captivating storytelling and stunning artwork.
- The book offers a unique reading experience and showcases the talent of the author and illustrator.

Bold Venture (complete) 50's Radio Show w/ Bogart and Bacall by Carl Amari (Tech)
- "Bold Venture" is a complete collection of the 50's radio show featuring Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall.
- The collection offers a nostalgic journey into the golden age of radio and showcases the iconic performances of the actors.

An Unexpected Soundscape & A Soundscape of Eä by Jordan Rannells (Tech)
- "An Unexpected Soundscape" and "A Soundscape of Eä" are two audio projects by Jordan Rannells.
- These projects provide immersive sound experiences that transport listeners to different worlds and evoke emotions.

The Hill of the Skull: A Photobook Memoir by Jeremy Bassetti by Jeremy Bassetti (Tech)
- "The Hill of the Skull" is a photobook memoir by Jeremy Bassetti, capturing his personal experiences and reflections.
- The book combines stunning photography with heartfelt storytelling, offering a unique perspective on life.
